cap_dock_arrival.title: Arrival at Capital Island
text: Your ship eases into the harbor of Capital Island under a sky crowded with flags.
Marines in crisp uniforms wave you toward an inspection pier. Loudspeakers repeat that the World Government keeps this sea safe.
Crew eyes drift between the spotless docks and the distant silhouettes of patrol ships.

choices.label: Dock at the official inspection pier.
outcome_text: You comply with the harbor officer's gestures and let the Marines secure your lines.
An officer in a pressed coat approaches with a clipboard and a practiced smile.

choices.label: Ask for a free strip away from the Marines.
outcome_text: You hail the harbor tower and request an independent dock. There is a pause, then an annoyed voice redirects you to a neglected berth at the edge of the harbor.
Nadia notes how empty that section is compared to the official piers.

cap_marines_brief.title: Harbor Briefing
text: Inside a cramped harbor office, a Marine officer outlines the 'current security situation'.
Charts on the wall show shipping lanes, red circles around 'pirate hotspots', and a neat banner: 'Peace Through Strength'.

choices.label: Nod along and accept their information.
outcome_text: You sign the standard forms and accept a stamped packet of 'safety advisories'.
The officer stresses that any unidentified ships should be reported immediately.

choices.label: Ask probing questions about 'pirate' incidents.
outcome_text: You press the officer about routes, casualty lists, and patterns. Answers come slower, less smooth.
A second officer quietly flips a ledger closed when you lean closer.

cap_newspaper_kiosk.title: Official News on the Street
text: On your way back to the ship, an official news kiosk blares headlines.
Front-page stories celebrate recent Marine 'victories' over pirates and praise increased patrol funding.

choices.label: Buy a newspaper and scan the details.
outcome_text: You buy a copy and skim the articles. Most quotes are from government spokespeople; names of 'pirates' are vague or redacted.
A small sidebar mentions a mining 'labor dispute' in passing.

choices.label: Ignore the headlines and head straight back.
outcome_text: You walk past the kiosk without stopping. Nadia lingers for a second, reading a headline about 'violent agitators' in a mining colony.
Back aboard, she keeps glancing at the folded corner of a free copy left on a crate.

cap_back_alley_rumors.title: Whispers by the Docks
text: Away from the official piers, the docks look older, patched together from mismatched wood and rusting metal.
A pair of stevedores argue in low voices about 'another raid' and 'people disappearing on Ashfall'.

choices.label: Pretend to check your lines and listen in.
outcome_text: You catch fragments: Marines, a night raid, miners taken for 'questioning' and never seen again.
When they notice you, the stevedores change the subject and hurry off.

choices.label: Approach and ask what happened.
outcome_text: At first they deny everything. When you insist you're not Marine, one finally mutters that 'not all pirates fly skulls' and that miners are being pushed too far.
They warn you to stay away from Ashfall unless you want trouble with both sides.

cap_censored_broadcast.title: Interrupted Broadcast
text: Back aboard your ship, the Den Den Mushi crackles with a scheduled news broadcast.
Halfway through an interview with a local merchant about 'rising tensions', the audio glitches, and the feed cuts to a cheerful anthem.

choices.label: Have Isha check the signal logs.
outcome_text: Isha pulls up the signal diagnostics: a spike in jamming at the exact second the interview took a critical turn.
The logs list the source as 'Government Relay Node â€“ Priority Override'.

choices.label: Assume it was just interference.
outcome_text: You chalk it up to bad weather or a faulty relay. Isha frowns but doesn't push it.
The Mushi plays the anthem three more times before static returns.

sea_patrol_intercept.title: Patrol Intercept
text: Hours out from Capital Island, a Marine patrol ship orders you to reduce speed.
They claim to be checking for 'pirate infiltration' and ask for your planned route.

choices.label: Share your intended route and cargo details.
outcome_text: You provide honest details. The patrol logs your route and warns you about 'aggressive pirate elements' near Ashfall.
Nadia quietly notes that they seem more interested in outbound ships than inbound ones.

choices.label: Give vague answers and a generic route.
outcome_text: You keep your answers noncommittal. The patrol lingers off your stern longer than necessary.
Isha picks up encrypted chatter mentioning your ship's ID.

sea_distress_signal.title: Distress in the Frontier
text: Later that night, the Den Den Mushi jolts awake with a faint distress call.
The voice is hurried, mentioning a mining convoy, 'unmarked hulls', and Marines 'protecting the wrong side'.

choices.label: Respond on an open channel.
outcome_text: You answer on the standard emergency frequency. The caller cuts off mid-sentence, replaced by Marine traffic insisting the situation is 'under control'.
Isha records a brief fragment with coordinates near Ashfall before the channel goes dead.

choices.label: Try to switch to a secure side channel.
outcome_text: Isha scrambles to lock in a narrowband connection. For a few seconds, you hear clear words: 'miners shot', 'resistance', 'Marines covering it up'.
A jamming spike cuts the line, but the coordinates and a ship name are saved.

ash_dock_tension.title: Tension at Ashfall
text: Ashfall's docks are crowded with ore barges and armed escorts. Marines watch from elevated platforms.
Workers move quickly, eyes down, while propaganda posters warn about 'pirate collaborators among the miners'.

choices.label: Dock at the Marine-controlled pier.
outcome_text: A local foreman is forced to speak highly of Marine protection with an officer looming nearby.
Off the record, his eyes say something different.

choices.label: Seek a berth among the miners' barges.
outcome_text: You find space between battered barges. A miner quietly asks if you heard a distress call recently.
They hint that not every 'pirate attack' is what the news claims.

ash_mine_tour.title: Tour of the Mines
text: You are escorted through the mine's loading areas. Work is loud, hurried, and heavily supervised.
Crude memorials for dead miners are tucked into corners away from Marine patrol routes.

choices.label: Speak to the company overseer.
outcome_text: The overseer repeats the official line: 'troublemakers', 'outside agitators', 'necessary discipline'.
When pressed about casualties, they insist all incidents are 'handled by the Marines'.

choices.label: Slip away to talk to workers directly.
outcome_text: In a dim side tunnel, miners tell you about raids labeled as 'anti-pirate operations' that only ever hit their organizers.
They ask if your ship can 'look the other way' if they ever call for help.

ash_night_meeting.title: A Meeting After Curfew
text: After dark, a coded knock on your gangplank announces visitors.
Hooded miners step aboard, asking for passage in exchange for the truth about 'pirate attacks'.

choices.label: Let them speak and listen fully.
outcome_text: They describe targeted arrests, staged raids, and Marines escorting ore shipments while beating down organizers.
They insist the so-called 'Crimson Tide' pirates are a convenient mask for crushing resistance.

choices.label: Refuse to get involved and send them away.
outcome_text: They leave in silence. Rook watches their shadows disappear into the dark and mutters that trouble will come here with or without you.
The night feels heavier than the smoke drifting from the mines.

ash_raid_aftermath.title: Raid at Dawn
text: At dawn, gunfire echoes across the docks. Marines storm a miners' dormitory, shouting about 'pirate collaborators'.
Smoke and shouting fill the air; official loudspeakers call it a 'successful anti-piracy operation'.

choices.label: Align with Marines and help secure the perimeter.
outcome_text: You offer your ship's sensors and crew to help 'identify threats'. The Marines accept, logging your cooperation.
The official report lists 'minimal collateral damage' and 'decisive action against piracy'.

choices.label: Quietly help miners escape under cover of chaos.
outcome_text: You use your tools to mark blind spots in Marine patrols. A handful of miners slip aboard small boats and vanish into the mist.
Later, Marine logs note 'suspected smuggler cooperation' but no evidence is found.

sea_smuggler_meet.title: Unmarked Sails
text: Far from the main lanes, your spyglass picks out an unmarked ship shadowing your course.
Its captain hails you on a narrow-band frequency, offering information about 'who really profits from piracy here'.

choices.label: Agree to meet alongside in calm waters.
outcome_text: Up close, the ship is patched and under-armed for a 'pirate'. The captain shares logs showing Marines escorting cargo one day and attacking 'pirates' the next.
They claim the Crimson Tide is mostly a story to justify tightening control.

choices.label: Threaten them and drive them off.
outcome_text: You warn them that Marines are watching and they'll be next. The unmarked ship fades into the haze without firing a shot.
Rook mutters that they didn't sail like raiders. Nadia logs the encounter anyway.

storm_edge_scan.title: The Shrouded Edge
text: Ahead, a wall of storm clouds rises like a living thing: the sea's infamous central maelstrom.
Instruments flicker. Compass and Log Pose needles twitch erratically as waves roll under your hull.

choices.label: Use all tools to scan the storm edge carefully.
outcome_text: You coordinate compass, spyglass, Mushi diagnostics, and Log Pose readings. Patterns emerge: gaps in patrol coverage, a rhythm in the storm itself.
You realize the storm hides routes too costly for the World Government to fully lock down.

choices.label: Trust your instincts and push closer.
outcome_text: Rook curses as the hull shudders. Instruments jump wildly, but in the chaos, you see a fleeting pattern in the arcs of lightning.
It's risky, but you feel you could thread a path if you commit.

storm_black_box.title: Black Box Broadcast
text: In the static at the storm's edge, the Den Den Mushi picks up a burst of compressed data.
Isha recognizes the signature: an emergency recorder from a ship 'lost to pirates' months ago.

choices.label: Decode it and compare with official reports.
outcome_text: The recorder tells a different story: Marines fired first on a 'suspect vessel', then reported the loss as piracy.
Official news omitted entire sections of the encounter.

choices.label: Forward the recorder directly to Marines.
outcome_text: You transmit the data to the nearest Marine relay. They reply with a curt thanks and an instruction not to speak of 'ongoing investigations'.
On open channels, the incident remains labeled a 'pirate attack'.

final_course_set.title: Course to the Truth
text: Back on the bridge, the crew looks to you. You have fragments of the truth: resistance pleas, doctored reports, censored broadcasts.
Ahead, the storm hides a route not even the World Government can fully script.

choices.label: Set a course that will turn your knowledge into open defiance.
outcome_text: You mark a route through the storm that will spread these truths to every island willing to listen.
Whatever waits beyond the maelstrom, you will not sail for the World Government again.

choices.label: Plan to work within the system, armed with what you know.
outcome_text: You set a route back toward Capital Island, intending to leak what you've learned carefully, choosing allies inside the system.
The storm remains at your back, a reminder that some truths are too large to hide forever.
